security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code, no file system access, and no network capabilities. This is a markdown specification file that defines an interactive workflow for generating structured software specifications.

content.value_statement: Writing clear software specifications from requirements is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill transforms natural language requirements into structured EPIC/Story/Subtask specifications using EARS notation through an interactive three-phase workflow.
actual_capabilities: Transform natural language requirements into structured EPIC/Story/Subtask specifications
Generate unambiguous acceptance criteria using EARS notation
Analyze existing codebase and propose technical designs with Mermaid diagrams
Manage workflow with three phases: Requirements, Design, and Task Breakdown
Create file templates with test case scaffolding
Integrate with branch and PR workflows automatically
limitations: Does not execute code or modify existing files automatically
Requires user confirmation at each phase transition
Does not validate requirements against external systems

use_cases.title: Define feature requirements
use_cases.description: Convert vague feature ideas into precise, testable specifications that developers can implement directly

use_cases.title: Structure technical designs
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive technical specifications including data flow diagrams and interface definitions

use_cases.title: Create backlog items
use_cases.description: Transform user requests into well-structured backlog items with clear acceptance criteria and task breakdowns

best_practices: Start with a clear, concise feature description including key requirements
Confirm each phase before proceeding to ensure alignment with your vision
Review generated acceptance criteria for completeness before implementation
anti_patterns: Providing overly vague requirements leads to unclear specifications
Skipping phase confirmations causes misalignment with user intent
Requesting implementation code in the specification phase

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works across all platforms where skills are supported.

faq.question: How detailed should my initial request be?
faq.answer: Include the feature name, key requirements, and any specific constraints. More detail produces better specifications.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only processes text locally. No data is sent to external servers. Generated files remain in your repository.

faq.question: Why does the skill ask for confirmation at each phase?
faq.answer: User confirmation ensures the specification aligns with your intent before proceeding. This prevents wasted effort.

faq.question: How is this different from regular prompt engineering?
faq.answer: This skill enforces a structured SDD methodology with three distinct phases, EARS notation, and automatic branch/PR integration.
